creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
description: teapot; body is made up of two stacked crates; handle is a cinderblock and a tire; stacked cans for spout; checker board and a Coca-Cola bottle for lid
text: Notkin’s teapots, mimicking the unglazed stoneware made in the Yixing region of China from the 1600s to the 1800s, are a perfect foil for his contemporary imagery. He stresses that his work must speak of our time—in this case, the unproven claims of weapons of mass destruction that sparked the United States’ involvement in the Iraq War in 2003.
title: Stacked Crates Teapot (Variation 9)
